intro: Breynia baudouinii, commonly known as the flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking, bright orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling flames. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that are typically dark green and arranged in opposite pairs. Breynia baudouinii is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes plants with diverse growth forms and ecological adaptations. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and dry forests.
